Files

cargo_doc2readme/
diagnostic.rs

1use ariadne::{Color, Label, Report, ReportKind};
2use std::{io, ops::Range};
3
4pub type Span = Range<usize>;
5
6fn config() -> ariadne::Config {
7	ariadne::Config::default().with_index_type(ariadne::IndexType::Byte)
8}
9
10pub struct Diagnostic {
11	filename: String,
12	code: String,
13	reports: Vec<Report<'static, (String, Span)>>,
14	fail: bool
15}
16
17impl Diagnostic {
18	pub fn new(filename: String, code: String) -> Self {
19		Self {
20			filename,
21			code,
22			reports: Vec::new(),
23			fail: false
24		}
25	}
26
27	pub fn is_fail(&self) -> bool {
28		self.fail
29	}
30
31	pub fn print(&self) -> io::Result<()> {
32		self.print_to(io::stderr())
33	}
34
35	pub fn print_to<W: io::Write>(&self, mut w: W) -> io::Result<()> {
36		let mut cache = (self.filename.clone(), self.code.clone().into());
37		for r in &self.reports {
38			r.write(&mut cache, &mut w)?;
39		}
40		Ok(())
41	}
42
43	fn offset(&self, at: proc_macro2::LineColumn) -> usize {
44		let line_offset: usize = self
45			.code
46			.split('\n')
47			.take(at.line - 1)
48			.map(|line| line.len() + 1)
49			.sum();
50		line_offset + at.column
51	}
52
53	fn offset_span(&self, span: proc_macro2::Span) -> Range<usize> {
54		self.offset(span.start()) .. self.offset(span.end())
55	}
56
57	/// Info without a code label.
58	pub fn info<T>(&mut self, msg: T)
59	where
60		T: ToString
61	{
62		self.reports.push(
63			Report::build(
64				ReportKind::Custom("info", Color::Green),
65				(self.filename.clone(), 0 .. 0)
66			)
67			.with_config(config())
68			.with_message(msg)
69			.finish()
70		);
71	}
72
73	/// Warning without a code label.
74	pub fn warn<T>(&mut self, msg: T)
75	where
76		T: ToString
77	{
78		self.reports.push(
79			Report::build(ReportKind::Warning, (self.filename.clone(), 0 .. 0))
80				.with_config(config())
81				.with_message(msg)
82				.finish()
83		);
84	}
85
86	/// Warning with a code label.
87	pub fn warn_with_label<T, L>(&mut self, msg: T, span: proc_macro2::Span, label: L)
88	where
89		T: ToString,
90		L: ToString
91	{
92		let span = self.offset_span(span);
93		self.reports.push(
94			Report::build(ReportKind::Warning, (self.filename.clone(), span.clone()))
95				.with_config(config())
96				.with_message(msg)
97				.with_label(Label::new((self.filename.clone(), span)).with_message(label))
98				.finish()
99		);
100	}
101
102	/// Warning that says that a macro was not expanded and helps to fix it.
103	pub fn warn_macro_not_expanded(&mut self, span: proc_macro2::Span) {
104		let span = self.offset_span(span);
105		self.reports.push(
106			Report::build(ReportKind::Warning, (self.filename.clone(), span.clone()))
107			.with_config(config())
108			.with_message("Macro not expanded")
109			.with_label(Label::new((self.filename.clone(), span)).with_message("This macro was not expanded"))
110			.with_help("You can use `--expand-macros` on a nightly Rust toolchain to expand macros.")
111			.finish()
112		);
113	}
114
115	/// Syntax error with the code span from syn's error.
116	pub fn syntax_error(&mut self, err: syn::Error) {
117		let span = self.offset_span(err.span());
118		let mut report = Report::build(ReportKind::Error, (self.filename.clone(), span))
119			.with_config(config());
120		report.set_message("Syntax Error");
121		for err in err {
122			let span = self.offset_span(err.span());
123			report.add_label(Label::new((self.filename.clone(), span)).with_message(err));
124		}
125		self.reports.push(report.finish());
126		self.fail = true;
127	}
128
129	/// Error without a code label.
130	pub fn error<T>(&mut self, msg: T)
131	where
132		T: ToString
133	{
134		self.reports.push(
135			Report::build(ReportKind::Error, (self.filename.clone(), 0 .. 0))
136				.with_config(config())
137				.with_message(msg)
138				.finish()
139		);
140		self.fail = true;
141	}
142}
